oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of dithiaporphyrin-based singlet-singlet energy transfer systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMARESAN, D
AGARWAL, N
RAVIKANTH, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: unsymmetrical porphyrin dimers
electrochemical properties
coupling reactions
arrays
design
21-thiaporphyrin
nickel(ii)
oligomers
dynamics
spectra
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The synthesis of the first alkynyl core-modified porphyrin building block, 5,10,15,20-tetrakis(4-ethynylphenyl)-21,23-dithiaporphyrin (N2S2 core), is reported. The building block was used to construct donor-appended dithiaporphyrin systems under mild palladium-coupling conditions. The porphyrin building block appended to four boron-dipyrrin units, (BDPY)(4)S2TPP, did not show any energy transfer from the BDPY unit to the central dithiaporphyrin core. However, the pentaporphyrin containing a central dithiaporphyrin sub-unit and four peripheral normal porphyrin sub-units (N-4 core) showed efficient energy transfer from the peripheral N-4 porphyrins to the central N2S2 porphyrin.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-PERKIN TRANSACTIONS 1, (14), 1644-1648
